titles.title: Child Health Incentives Reform Plan
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny an employer a deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes 1st dollar coverage for pediatric health care.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/9/1987--Introduced. Child Health Incentives Reform Plan - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny employers an income tax deduction for group health plan expenses unless the plan provides first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care with respect to any child under age 18. Lists services, including dental services, included as pediatric preventive health care.
